© 2020

  • Short Bio

  • I am a first-year Master’s student in Brown University, working with Prof. Michael Littman and Prof. George Konidaris. I obtained my B.S from Beihang University, under supervision of Prof. Jingyuan Wang.

    My research interest lies in reinforcement learning and deep learning robustness. I studied how to defense adversarial attacks during my undergraduate when I was fascinated about learning robust cognitive machine with reliable generalization ability and low sample complexity. I want to know how we can get so much from so little through the perspective of reinforcement learning, an abstract computational framework.

    More specifically, I am currently focused on learning abstractions and utilizing the relational structure of obervations to achieve generalizable sample efficient agent.
